chapsoc31.Description: 31. I have often found it hard to resist talking to a good friend, even whenI have other things to do.

chapsoc6.Description: 6. Playing with children is a real chore.

chapsoc30.Description: 30. It made me sad to see all my high school friends go their separate ways when high school was over.

chapsoc17.Description: 17. I prefer hobbies and leisure activi-ties that do not involve other people.

chapsoc34.Description: 34. People who try to get to know me better usually give up after awhile.

chapsoc11.Description: 11. When things are going really good for my close friends, it makes me feel good too.

chapsoc2.Description: 2. I attach very little importance to having close friends.

chapsoc4.Description: 4. A car ride is much more enjoyable if someone is with me.

chapsoc13.Description: 13. My emotional responses seem very different from those of other people.

chapsoc27.Description: 27. I am usually content to just sit alone, thinking and daydreaming.

chapsoc9.Description: 9. I sometimes become deeply attached to people I spend a lot of time with.

chapsoc29.Description: 29. There are few things more tiring than to have a long, personal discussion with someone.

chapsoc22.Description: 22. Although I know I should have affection for certain people, I don't really feel it.

chapsoc7.Description: 7. I have always enjoyed looking at photographs of friends.

chapsoc8.Description: 8. Although there are things that I enjoy doing by myself, I usually seem to have more fun when I do things with other people.

chapsoc32.Description: 32. Making new friends isn't worth the energy it takes.

chapsoc18.Description: 18. It's fun to sing with other people.

chapsoc20.Description: 20. When I move to a new city, I feel a strong need to make new friends.

chapsoc21.Description: 21. People are usually better off if they stay aloof from emotional involvements with most others.

chapsoc15.Description: 15. Just being with friends can make me feel really good.

chapsoc5.Description: 5. I like to make long distance phone calls to friends and relatives.

chapsoc24.Description: 24. I feel pleased and gratified as I learn more and more about the emotional life of my friends.

chapsoc14.Description: 14. When I am alone, I often resent people telephoning me or knocking on my door.

chapsoc38.Description: 38. I don't really feel very close to my friends.

chapsoc23.Description: 23. People often expect me to spend more time talking with them than Iwould like.

chapsoc37.Description: 37. I find that people too often assume that their daily activities and opinions will be interesting to me.

chapsoc26.Description: 26. I never had really close friends in high school.

chapsoc40.Description: 40. In many ways, I prefer the company of pets to the company of people.

chapsoc28.Description: 28. I'm much too independent to really get involved with other people.

chapsoc36.Description: 36. If given the choice, I would much rather be with others than be alone.

chapsoc3.Description: 3. I prefer watching television to going out with other people.

chapsoc35.Description: 35. I could be happy living all alone in a cabin in the woods or mountains.

chapsoc33.Description: 33. There are things that are more important to me than privacy.

chapsoc1.Description: 1. Having close friends is not as important as many people say.

chapsoc16.Description: 16. When things are bothering me, I like to talk to other people about it.

chapsoc39.Description: 39. My relationships with other people never get very intense.

chapsoc19.Description: 19. Knowing that I have friends who care about me gives me a sense of security.

chapsoc12.Description: 12. When someone close to me is depressed, it brings me down also.

chapsoc25.Description: 25. When others try to tell me about their problems and hang-ups, Iusually listen with interest and attention.

chapsoc10.Description: 10. People sometimes think that I am shy when I really just want to be left alone.
